data.title: Split action seems to inherit a few opened files from an existing group
data.body:
Testing #6536

From this state:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/15505900/adadc006-21c5-11e6-9d18-54a639573337.png)

Split the first editor and you get this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/15505909/b587a90e-21c5-11e6-9c51-def4bfb69e25.png)

I expected:
- Left with `appveyour.yml`
- Center with `appveyour.yml`
- Right with `package.json`

data.title: Badly formed version information in the VSCodeSetup.exe
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Win 8.1

Just downloaded `VSCodeSetup-stable.exe`.
Sadly it shows version `0.0.0.0` in numerical file and product versions, and "0.0.0.0" in string file version.
Only string product version contains proper "1.1.1".
Please clean up them to let users see proper version in file managers.

data.title: Code format stopped working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Debian Jessie

Steps to Reproduce:

Really hard to say once again. Everything was fine for a week or so but then the code format just does nothing. Which is a bitch. Also seems to start with random indentation time to times when for example { is added and enter pressed. 

Only error I got from the developer console is this:

/usr/share/code/resources/app/node_modules/vscode-textmate/release/main.js:1232
Grammar is in an endless loop - case 1

I know that these reports without real "how to reproduce" are sometimes a bit useless but just reporting so that somebody could help or take a note.

data.title: passing a non-existing launch config to 'vscode.startDebug' does not return an error
data.body:
While testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6248:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0 alpha
- OS Version: OS X

Passing a non existing launch config name to the 'vscode.startDebug' command does not result in an error but launches the first launch config instead.

Since the 'vscode.startDebug' command has become part of our 'official' API, we have to protect ourselves against incorrect values and we have to produce meaningful errors.

data.title: Migrated opened files should not be italic
data.body:
Testing #6536

The migrated opened files from the last time I had Code running, before stacks, should not be italic.

data.title: code-alpha --install-extension errors are in JSON
data.body:
Testing #6099

```
> code-alpha --install-extension vscode-css-formatter
{ responseText: '{"$id":"1","innerException":null,"message":"The query supplied was not valid, one of the filters contained an error. The fully qualified name MUST contain a \'.\' between the publisher and extension names.","typeName":"Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Gallery.WebApi.InvalidExtensionQueryException, Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Gallery.WebApi","typeKey":"InvalidExtensionQueryException","errorCode":0,"eventId":3000}',
  status: 500,
  getResponseHeader: [Function],
  readyState: 4 }
```

Having the error as JSON is uncommon. Should be a human readable string.
If structured error messages are useful, maybe add a extra option to the command that defines the resonse format.

data.title: Closing all files in a group except for a markdown file does not update overflow control icon
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open multiple files into one group, ensure a markdown file is open
2. In the open editors list, close all files except the markdown file

Expected: Markdown editor overflow control should indicate that the group only contains one file
Actual: Overflow control indicates that there are multiple files in the group

data.title: Preview file does not split
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a markdown file
2. Click the preview button
3. Now click the split button

Expected: editor to split and show preview in both editors
Actual: Nothing happens

data.body:

Maybe this should be filed to the original JS tty implementation.

When typing a command name in the prompt like:

And tabbing, I get a few characters repeated:

Only seems to happen in zsh, not bash.

data.title: Terminal: should inherit editor font by default
data.body:
Testing #6654

The terminal should inherit the editor's font family and size, by default, instead of providing another default list of fonts.

data.title: Terminal: Can't press Escape key

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #6654

The escape key surfaces to the workbench, closing the terminal. This is bad in situations where commands really need the escape key, such as vim.

data.title: Fill settings automatically when associating file extensions
data.body:
The user should be able to make a permanent decision of associating a file extension to a mode. This could work as follows:
- user selects clicks on language picker
- user clicks on entry to "Permanently associate extension"
- user gets asked for the language mode to store
- user gets asked to store it in workspace or global settings
- change is made and user is informed that settings have been updated and if he wants to review

For this we need a couple of things:
- being able to write to workspace settings and not only global settings
- finding out if the settings file is currently dirty (if that is true we either abort or update the buffer).

//cc @aeschli

data.title: Improve editor.stablePeek documentation
data.body:
Testing #6662

The current message for `editor.stablePeek` is:

> Do not close peek editors when double clicking their content or when hitting Escape.

Maybe rephrase it to:

> Keep peek editors open even when double clicking their content or when hitting Escape.

data.title: I can recursively peek definitions
data.body:
Testing #6662

Recursively peeking definitions ends in this state:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/15504256/689ea630-21be-11e6-82f7-4afb8f934690.png)

After the first peek, the trees in the following peeks are always empty.

Is this expected?

data.title: dragging an editor pins it
data.body:
#6536
- open two different files in two groups - both editors a preview-editors
- use the Open Editors and drop the editor from the _right_ group up to the _left_
- the editor is now pinned and not in preview anymore

data.title: Configure file associations not inserting value when settings is dirty and value got removed before
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. auto save off
2. open JSON file
3. Configure File Association
4. Remove inserted association but don't save
5. redo step 3

Observe: nothing is inserted into the settings file. I know why, but from a user presepctove not expected.

data.title: Configure file association action insert broken rule for default settings file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-alpha
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Configure setting
2. Put cursor into 'Default Settings' editor
3. Press on JSON in the status bar and execute 'Configure File Association....'

Observe: a rule like this is inserted:

``` json
    "": "json"
```

Either the action should be disabled for the default settings editor or the property should be something like "Default Settings"

data.title: openEditors.visible and openEditors.maxVisible
data.body:
#6536

We have two competing/overlapping settings with  "explorer.openEditors.maxVisible" and "explorer.openEditors.visible". I suggest to remove the latter and embrace the already implemented behaviour of `maxVisible = 0`.

data.title: JSON rewriting support should offer to write to user or workspace settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-alpha
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a workspace with workspace settings
2. Follow steps in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6657

Observe: a message appears that asks you that you have workspace settings and answer with open workspace settings. However the opened workspace setting doesn't contain the file association. It is still added to global settings.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-alpha
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. set "editor.wordBasedSuggestions": false
2. open a markdown file
3. request code complete

Observe: the list contains word based suggestions:

data.title: double vs single down arrow is bad alternative to enablement
data.body:
#6536

The editor groups show a double down arrow to toggle between different editors of the group. When there is only a single editor in the group, the group shows a single arrow. Instead of changing the icon it should use enablement to show if there is more than one editor in a group.

data.title: Peek definition and goto definition for css?
data.body:
#6655
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a .css file notice that there are 'Peek definition' and ' goto definition'
2. These actions do not do anything in css - why do we have them in the context menu?
3. I would expect them not to be in the context menu - same as for .html
